problem.markdown:
On the [mathjaxinline]p-V[/mathjaxinline] diagram of a simple system, how many times will an isothermal line and an isentropic line intersect each other?
( ) They will not intersect. (x) They will intersect just once. ( ) They will intersect twice. ( ) They may intersect any number of times.
[explanation] A given value of temperature (as represented by the isotherm and a given value of entropy (as represented by the isentrope, determine the state of the simple system uniquely. [explanation]
